direction.raw_text: . UNDERGROUND PARKING LOT/ APARTMENT/ KOREATOWN - NIGHT. 3 Driver strides through a dimly lit car park, carrying his duffel bag. direction.raw_text: . DRIVER'S CAR/ ALVARADO - NIGHT. 4 The Clippers-Knicks game plays on the car radio now. Driver is only half listening, focused on the road. We see his face in the passing neon lights. Feline good looks. Impassive blue eyes. Something almost melancholy in his unwavering gaze. He drives carefully, letting other cars overtake.

direction.raw_text: . APARTMENT BUILDING/ ECHO PARK - NIGHT. 5 Driver glides into the parking lot of another low-rent apartment block.

direction.raw_text: . SILVER IMPALA/ TOY DISTRICT/ DOWNTOWN L.A. - NIGHT. 10 The basketball game is approaching the end of the third quarter. Driver's behind the wheel of the Impala now, cruising past rows of dingy toy stores on 3rd Street. He glances at his watch. It's
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: :50. He checks his mirror then turns into a side street.

direction.raw_text: . IMPALA/ ELECTRONICS SUPERSTORE/ DOWNTOWN - NIGHT. 11 A vast electronics superstore dominates the deserted street. Under the pale yellow glow of the street lamps, Driver sees signs advertising a `huge blow out weekend sale'. He pulls over, making sure he has a good view of the entrance. On the radio, the basketball commentator is getting more excited.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...This is some comeback from the Clippers! Only a few minutes ago they looked dead and buried!... Driver reaches under the seat and pulls out a small handheld scanner. He switches it on, tuning it to the right frequency. Crackling police dispatches are interspersed with the basketball commentary now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...9 Adam 81, what is your current location?...Repeat, what is your current location?...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Another unbelievable three pointer from Davis and the Clippers are within five!... Out of the corner of his eye Driver sees two MEN approach. He doesn't react, expecting them. They cut through the fence with bolt cutters and approach the main building. Driver watches them pull on their masks, then one of them takes out a shotgun and blasts the lock to the front door. Instantly the alarm shrills. The only thing Driver does is to turn on his stop watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Time out Knicks... The stop watching keeps ticking away, the siren blaring, the commentary continuing, the police scanner crackling. The storefront is hidden in shadow, impossible to tell what's going on inside. Driver looks at his stop watch. Almost three minutes. One of the masked men emerges now, carrying a duffel bag. He hurries over and gets in the back of Driver's car without a word. There's no sign of the other robber. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The commentary continues, so does the crackling on the police scanner. Four minutes. Still no sign of the second armed robber. His companion in the back starts to look nervous, wondering what's happened to his partner. Driver doesn't betray a hint of nerves. Four and half minutes on his stop watch. Thirty seconds more and he's on his way. Suddenly the second robber appears from the shadows, running as fast as he can to the getaway car. He jumps into the back seat a few seconds short of five minutes and Driver screeches off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SILVER IMPALA/ STREETS/ DOWNTOWN - NIGHT. 12 Driver thunders over the 1st Street bridge towards Boyle Heights, then eases his foot off the gas, slowing to a steady speed. In the back seat the two armed robbers rip off their masks, looking pumped up with adrenalin. Driver studies them in his rear view mirror, then swerves right on Mission Street as his police scanner crackles to life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Attention all units...211...Superstore on Traction Avenue...Suspects headed Eastbound on 1st Street...Driving a Silver Impala... Driver swings sharply into 4th Street now, crossing the L.A. River again, heading back in the same direction he came.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Airships dispatched...Downtown and Boyle Heights...All units standby. Repeat, all units standby... Up ahead, the lights of Downtown L.A. glitter against the night sky. Hovering between the neon green glow of the skyscrapers Driver sees the red and white glint of a police helicopter. He switches off his headlights, turning left on Santa Fe Avenue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . IMPALA/ALLEYWAYS/INDUSTRIAL AREA/DOWNTOWN - NIGHT. 13 The armed robbers watch in tense silence as Driver weaves in and out of the industrial alleyways with his lights switched off. It's as if he's trying to find his way out of the maze or probing to see if there's anyone out there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...1 Baker 11, headed south on Boyle Avenue...No sign of suspects...Repeat, no sign of suspects... The armed robbers look relieved when suddenly a police car glides past at the end of the alleyway, its lights also off. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's like catching a glimpse of a passing shark's fin. Driver taps the brakes gently, his car sliding to a stop. He stays there a moment, then eases the Impala forward, turning in the same direction as the black-and-white.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: IMPALA/ LA RIVER INDUSTRIAL AREA/ DOWNTOWN

direction.raw_text: . IMPALA/ LA RIVER INDUSTRIAL AREA/ DOWNTOWN - NIGHT. 14 It's a high-risk strategy but Driver follows the black-and-white at a distance, hidden in the darkness, knowing other squad cars won't be checking the same route. The police car makes its way through the dimly lit industrial zone, unaware it's being shadowed. Driver turns his car radio up a whisper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...And for the first time in the game the Clippers have the lead. 71 to 69. Seven to go in the Fourth here at the Staples Centre... Driver turns the sound back down. Up ahead, the police car swings left, disappearing from view. Driver slows down too, anticipating the next obstacle. He doesn't have long to wait. In the distance he suddenly sees the piercing beam of a police chopper's search-lights, sweeping the area one more time. Driver floors the gas, speeding straight towards the approaching helicopter. The armed robbers are too stunned to protest. They just sit there, watching the sweeping searchlights getting closer and closer. Then suddenly it becomes clear what Driver's doing. Up ahead, there's a small underpass below the 7th Street bridge. Driver slides the car under the safety of the bridge just before the chopper's searchlights spot them.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: IMPALA/ UNDERPASS/ LA RIVER INDUSTRIAL AREA

direction.raw_text: . IMPALA/ UNDERPASS/ LA RIVER INDUSTRIAL AREA - NIGHT.15 The roar of the helicopter thunders overhead. The underpass is crammed with dirty mattresses and shopping carts. Sleeping HOBOS can be seen under dirty blankets. Driver waits for the echo of the helicopter to fade, then moves forward again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . IMPALA/ OLYMPIC BOULEVARD/ DOWNTOWN - NIGHT. 16 Gloomy yellow street-lamps shine down on the industrial zone. Rows of delivery trucks are parked outside the meat-packing factories. Driver cruises cautiously down the deserted street. The crackling of the police scanner and the droning of the basketball commentary add to the tension. Finally up ahead he sees car-lights streaming back and forth on Broadway.

direction.raw_text: Get down... (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: The armed robbers lie flat on the back seat, paying Driver more respect now.

direction.raw_text: . IMPALA/ BROADWAY/ DOWNTOWN - NIGHT. 17 There's a steady flow of traffic on Broadway. Driver falls in behind the other cars. On the radio, the basketball game is still playing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Three thirteen left on the clock. Dunleavy calls a time out and it's the Clippers by one... The passing head-lamps light up Driver's face. There's not a trace of emotion in his eyes -- even when he spots a patrol car approaching in the opposite direction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Buckle up your seat belts Clippers fans. This game really is too close to call... The two cars pass each other slowly. Driver sees the cops in the Black-and-White peering at the Impala as they head past. He turns down the basketball game and focuses on the scanner.

direction.raw_text: ...This is 1 David 16...Silver Impala headed South on Broadway and Pico...Couldn't get a look at her license plates...Appears to be only one occupant... In the back seat, the armed robbers wait nervously for the police dispatch to respond.

direction.raw_text: ...1 David 16...why don't you check her out... As soon as he hears this Driver swerves sharply into the next street.

direction.raw_text: . IMPALA/ SIDESTREET OFF BROADWAY/ DOWNTOWN - NIGHT. 18 Driver guns around the block now, building up speed.

direction.raw_text: ...This is 1 David 16...We lost the suspect somewhere between Broadway and Grand...Possible evasive action...Request airship and additional units...

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...1 David 11...suspect headed West on Pico... Driver threads his way through the vehicles in front of him, so smooth and effortless it's hard to tell how fast he's going. He glances up as he hears the dull rumble of a police chopper overhead. The helicopter is almost directly above him, swinging its search-beam back and forth to get a lock on his position. Driver pushes the car as fast as it will go, but there's no way of outrunning the chopper. Blue light floods the asphalt around him as he guns down Figueroa.

direction.raw_text: . IMPALA/ STAPLES CENTRE/ PARKING LOT - NIGHT. 20 The terraced parking lot looms up ahead. A sign above the barrier says `Season Ticket Holders Only'. Driver punches in a ticket and roars into the parking lot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . IMPALA/ STAPLES CENTRE PARKING LOT - NIGHT. 21 The Impala screeches from one level to the next. With a game going on, the parking lot is almost full. Finally Driver pulls into a free parking space.

STAPLES CENTRE/ DOWNTOWN L.A. - NIGHT. 22 Outside the parking lot, the police are waiting, stopping anything that looks like an Impala, shining their flashlights into the windows. Wearing his Clippers cap and a Clippers sticker on his new car, Driver calmly drives past them, making his getaway.

direction.raw_text: Driver slows to forty, like he's supposed to, but the black Charger keeps coming at speed. Driver's eyes stay fixed on his rear view mirror, judging the other car's speed and angle of approach to perfection. The Charger slams into the back of Driver's car at sixty miles an hour, hitting him just above the left rear wheel. Driver's reactions are quick as lightning, counter-steering as his Black-and-White goes careening off the road. He keeps the car upright long enough to slow it down before it finally flips end over end. Up ahead, the Charger skids to a showy stop.

direction.raw_text: ...And CUT!... Some clapping and cheering breaks out, but most the crew couldn't care less, returning to their cell-phones and shot lists. Only Shannon seems interested in Driver, limping over and helping him out of his battered Black-and-White.

direction.raw_text: . NINO'S PIZZERIA/ WESTWOOD - DAY. 27 A New York style pizza-by-the-slice restaurant. A WAITER takes a delivery of Chinese food at the door and carries it over to a table where Shannon is sitting with an old friend, BERNIE ROSE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here you go, Mr. Rose. (Taking out the white boxes) Egg rolls, chicken chow mein, five flavor shrimp and Peking duck.

direction.raw_text: deals. We'll even name the team after you. Bernie looks at his friend in mild exasperation then turns away as the waiter returns with a handful of chop sticks.

Driver picks up the remote and flicks through the channels until he finally finds a breaking news story on the robbery. There is a police mug-shot of Standard on screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...The armed robber was pronounced dead at the scene. He was identified as Standard Guzman of Echo Park, Los Angeles... Driver listens to the report in silence. Blanche seems upset again, confronted with the reality of what's happened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Other details are unclear but the owner of the pawn shop told reporters that the robber had no accomplices and that the items he'd taken had been recovered. In other news... Driver switches off the TV, staring at the blank screen in surprise. He turns to Blanche.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The guy saw you grab the money and jump in the car -- why didn't he say anything?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've no idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any idea there'd be another car waiting? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This time she takes a fraction too long to answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I already told you everything - Driver suddenly slaps her -- hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You just got a little kid's father killed. You think I won't hurt you? He raises his hand to slap her again and this time she talks, tears welling in her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Cook told me another car would hold us up...but he never said anything about this much money or anyone getting killed... Driver stares at her quietly, beginning to put the pieces together in his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were gonna rip us off and split the take? She nods guiltily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long have you known him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just a couple months. We were fooling around. I've never been mixed up in anything like this -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know his real name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He told me it was Chris, but I just called him Cook.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're going to take me to him right now, you understand? She nods, terrified, tears running down her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ....Can I go wash up?... Driver nods distractedly, his mind racing. Blanche heads over to the bathroom. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As she disappears inside Driver notices something on the bed where she's just been lying. It's her cell phone. Still flipped open as if she's called someone recently. Driver reaches for the cell phone when he notices the silhouette of a MAN crossing the curtains. Someone's outside. The door handle of the motel room starts to turn, slowly -- then suddenly there's the roar of a shotgun from the bathroom. Driver reacts in an instant, rushing towards the bathroom door. He has to barge it open, something obstructing his way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BATHROOM/ MOTEL ROOM - DAY. 87 Driver almost trips over Blanche's sprawled body as he bursts through. One quick glance and he knows she's dead - half her head blown off. Another quick glance and he sees her killer, a big burly HITMAN, trying to climb through the same bathroom window where he just shot her. Driver moves like lightning, grabbing the man's arms before he can get off another shot and pulling him through the window. The hitman lands heavily in a sea of broken glass, cutting his forehead open, blinded momentarily by the blood in his eyes. Driver takes his opportunity and slams the man's face back into the glass strewn floor, stunning him for a few more seconds as they struggle. Crawling away, he grabs the towel rack and pulls the metal bar off the wall. Using it as a spear he impales the hitman and grabs his shotgun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MOTEL ROOM - DAY. 88 In the bedroom, the 2nd HITMAN finally kicks the door open. Driver bursts through the bathroom door at the same time -- firing the 1st shooter's shotgun. The force of the blast picks up the 2nd hitman and flings him against the wall like a rag doll. The startling explosion of violence is over just as suddenly as it began. Driver slumps to the floor in exhaustion, his hand and his arm ripped open by the broken glass. There's blood splatter all over the wall. Neon lights from outside flashing on the dead man's face. But no panicked footsteps or sirens yet. Driver crawls over to the dead hitman and rifles through his pockets. All he finds are a set of car keys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . OFFICE/ SHANNON'S GARAGE - DAY. 89 Shannon stands in his office, listening silently on the phone, looking like he's been punched in the gut. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why didn't you tell me?... All he hears is silence on the other end.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I guess it's done now... He leans back against a car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How big's the take?...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One million I guess...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus... He looks dazed by the thought of so much money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You better bring it over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm hurt. I need a doctor to patch me up...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll take care of it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . OFFICE/ SHANNON'S GARAGE - NIGHT. 91 An underworld doctor, "DOC", a shabbily dressed old man who looks well past his prime takes out a small bottle of scotch along with his surgical tools, preparing for Driver's arrival. Shannon watches him uncertainly then heads downstairs as he hears a noise in the garage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SHANNON'S GARAGE - NIGHT. 92 Shannon arrives downstairs to see Driver walking unsteadily towards him in the gloom. Shannon can't help glancing at his hands, expecting him to be carrying the bag with the money, but there's no sign of it.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: OFFICE/ SHANNON'S GARAGE/ SILVER LAKE BOULEVARD

direction.raw_text: . OFFICE/ SHANNON'S GARAGE/ SILVER LAKE BOULEVARD - NIGHT.93 Scissoring Driver's blood soaked shirt away Doc examines the shards of glass embedded in his arm, then notices the deep scars running down his back. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Looks like you got more metal inside you than a ten ton truck... (His hand shakes) You'd be better off with a mechanic not a medic... Driver looks up at him warily from Shannon's pull out bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Relax. Just having my fun with you... Doc picks up his bottle of scotch from among his bowls of Peroxide and Betadine, takes a drink, then offers it to Driver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take a hit off that. Chances are you'll need it... Driver shakes his head, closing his eyes. Shannon watches him quietly, concerned for him but also curious about the money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you do with the cash?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's safe. Shannon hesitates, but can't help himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want me to look after it for you? Driver doesn't answer, gritting his teeth as Doc pulls out the largest shard of glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just think what we could do with all that
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two guys just tried to kill me for it. I want to find out who it belongs to first... Shannon nods, coming back down to earth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This guy Cook got a real name?...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe Chris. Probably not...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll ask Bernie if he's heard of him... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Driver grimaces again as Doc pulls out another shard of glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wish you'd talked to me first... Driver doesn't reply, his eyes fixed on the ceiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lotta guys fall for other mens' wives, but you're the only one I know robs a joint to make it up to the husband...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BERNIE ROSE'S APARTMENT - DAY. 94 An elegant apartment full of framed photographs of beautiful grandchildren and movie posters from Hollywood's golden age. Bernie is in his silk pyjamas, looking like he's just woken up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want some coffee?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, thanks... Shannon looks tense but tries to hide it. From next door they can hear the sound of raised voices. Bernie Rose grabs the TV remote and turns up the volume to drown out his neighbors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They've been going at it ever since they moved in. She's such a nice lady but it's a lousy Shidach. It's a wonder they haven't killed each other... (A BEAT) So, what's your interest in the Seventh Heaven? Shannon doesn't understand, looking confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a strip joint on La Cienega. Your friend Cook runs it. Why're you curious about him all of a sudden? Even though they're close, Shannon's wary of giving away too much information.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A friend of mine owes him some money. I was wondering if you knew him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I know him. He's a crazy Albanian. If I were your friend I'd pay up. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie Rose pours himself a cup of coffee in the kitchenette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wake me up this early this friend must be a close friend?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's our car by the way?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're all set for next month.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And our driver?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's doing great.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what you should worry about... Shannon smiles back but Bernie senses how distracted he is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want my advice? Let your friend work it out for himself. Don't take pills for other people's headaches... (HE GRINS) You got twenty minutes? I need you to run down to the market and get me some milk...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HALL/ STAIRS/ STRIP JOINT - DAY. 96 Sunlight pours through a doorway. Driver heads down some stairs, passing some half naked STRIPPERS at the bar. There's a handful of CLIENTS watching a pole dance, but otherwise the place is empty. Driver turns down a long corridor. A couple of STRIPPERS emerge from their changing room, surprised to see him, but he puts them at ease with a friendly smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cook moved office again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That one over there... Driver smiles gratefully, then heads towards an office at the end of the corridor. He knocks on the door. A voice calls back. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: COOK O/S It's open... Driver takes a hammer out of his jacket, then starts turning the door handle as if he can't get in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's open, goddamit!... He hears Cook striding impatiently towards the door now. He waits, then suddenly kicks the door open, right in Cook's face. Before Cook can recover, Driver storms into the office, smashing him across the shoulder with the hammer. Cook collapses in a heap. Driver's about to hit him again, when he sees that Cook's left hand is broken and there are cuts and bruises on his face. Someone's clearly given him a beating since the robbery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Should've figured you for a shill. Who were you fronting for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck you - Driver smashes the hammer into Cook's right hand now, breaking it too. Cook screams. Some of the strippers have gathered at the door but Driver couldn't care less.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whose money am I holding?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry. They'll come get it. You don't know who you're fucking with - Driver smashes the hammer into the metal plates supporting Cook's left hand. He screams like a stuck pig.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's money am I holding?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Barely able to get the words out) Fuck you... The strippers look stunned and riveted at the same time. Driver bends over Cook and rifles through his pockets. Finally he finds what he's looking for. Cook's cell phone. He scrolls down the call log and finds the same number appearing again and again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NINO'S PIZZERIA - DAY. 98 The kitchen is busy, CHEFS taking out hot pizzas from the oven and slicing them up in takeaway boxes. In the background we hear the phone ringing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BACK ROOM/ PIZZERIA - DAY. 99 An impeccably dressed MAN IN A TAN SUIT answers the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello?...I'm afraid we're closed. Could you call back after twelve...
direction.name: direction

result.heading: PARKING LOT/ BURGER KING/ SUNSET BOULEVARD

direction.raw_text: . PARKING LOT/ BURGER KING/ SUNSET BOULEVARD - DAY. 100 (INTERCUT) Driver leans against his car, talking on Cook's cell phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I could, but your boss won't be happy when he finds out you've kept him waiting... Tan Suit looks curious now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I ask what this is about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have something that belongs to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that would be?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A million dollars... There's a pause on the other line now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please hold...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NINO'S PIZZERIA - DAY. 101 Tan Suit walks into the dining area. A large bull of a man sits on his own in the empty restaurant with his back to us. It's only when he hears Tan Suit approach and turns around that we realize it's Nino, Bernie's partner.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: PARKING LOT/ BURGER KING/ SUNSET BOULEVARD

direction.raw_text: . PARKING LOT/ BURGER KING/ SUNSET BOULEVARD - DAY. 102 Driver hears a heavy chesty voice come on the line. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: NINO O/S You have something that fucking belongs to me?... The voice is unmistakable. Driver stares quietly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seems that way... (INTERCUT)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you're calling me why? You expect me to buy my fucking stuff back from you?...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not selling. I give you a time and place, you come collect your stuff...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what do you get out of it?...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just that. Out of it. You put a muzzle on Cook, forget your zombies at the Motel, forget we ever had this conversation... Nino's thinking to himself, looking more concerned than he sounds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your partners happy with that?...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't have partners...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You discuss this with anyone else?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just you... Nino begins to relax now, still calculating.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not very good at this, are you?...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This isn't what I do. I'll call again with instructions... Driver switches the cell phone off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BACK ROOM/ NINO'S PIZZERIA - DAY. 103 Nino hangs up. Behind him we see that Tan Suit is also in the room, waiting for his orders.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: LIVING ROOM/ IRENE'S APARTMENT/ ECHO PARK

direction.raw_text: . LIVING ROOM/ IRENE'S APARTMENT/ ECHO PARK - NIGHT. 104 Irene is sitting on the couch next to Benicio, talking to him gently as he watches TV.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...I'll be back before you go to bed. How's that sound?... The little boy nods, watching his Japanese cartoon. Irene's friend, Cindy, is also there, gazing at them both in sympathy. Irene looks up at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you going to be okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll be fine... Irene gets up to leave when the buzzer rings. She walks over and opens the door then stops in surprise. Driver stands there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got a minute?... She looks at him in a daze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where have you been?... He stares back at her in silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I tried to reach you. Standard's been -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know... His eyes stay on her, as if he's trying to tell her something more. She looks confused, staring back at him curiously when a small voice interrupts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey... Driver looks over at the little boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Irene begins to see the guilt in his eyes and slowly it hits her. She stares in disbelief, reeling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry about your father... Benicio nods. Driver keeps staring at the boy but can't find any more words of comfort. Irene watches him, still stunned. He looks back at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't talk now. I have to go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I give you a ride? She stares at him in dismay, close to tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The car's working fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then let me walk you down... She wants to say no but can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CORRIDOR/ APARTMENT/ ECHO PARK - NIGHT. 105 Driver and Irene head down the long corridor in silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Almost a whisper) Why?... Driver misunderstands, thinking she's talking about Standard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was into one of the prison gangs for a lot of money. He was trying to protect you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great job... She walks faster now, striding towards the elevator. Driver follows her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I still have the money. Whatever you need - She turns around and slaps him hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you, a bank? I work for a living. I don't need your widow's pension! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her eyes well up with tears, staring at him in anger and frustration.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just tell me one thing. How did he talk you into it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He didn't talk me into anything. I've been doing this my whole life. It's what I do... She stares at him in deep disappointment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stupid me... She turns away when the elevator bell rings. The doors open, revealing TAN SUIT. Neither Driver or Irene recognizes him but we do. He smiles, pretending to look confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, I'm supposed to be going down...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So are we... She steps into the elevator. Driver follows her in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which floor?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Parking lot, please... Tan Suit presses the button and the doors slide shut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ELEVATOR/ APARTMENT BLOCK/ ECHO PARK - NIGHT. 106 Driver and Irene ride down in silence, their eyes fixed on each other. Tan Suit watches them quietly, considering a move, but Driver glances at him and he smiles, biding his time. The lights on the panel descend. The elevator bell finally rings as they reach the lower level. Tan Suit hesitates, but Driver waits for him to go out first. He nods goodnight and heads off into the darkness of the parking lot. Driver follows Irene, the two of them heading in the opposite direction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . UNDERGROUND GARAGE/ APARTMENT/ ECHO PARK - NIGHT. 107 The overhead lights flicker, the huge underground car park hidden in shadow. Driver walks alongside Irene in silence. In the distance Tan Suit's footsteps slowly fade. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm leaving. I want you to come with me... Irene can't believe what she's hearing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You and Benicio... She's almost too stunned to speak, walking even faster now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're crazy. I don't even know you -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You will. Once I straighten out this thing I'm getting out for good. We'll go some place. Anywhere you want. She shakes her head, fighting her feelings for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It doesn't work like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not?... She stops and looks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because people like you never get out. And I don't want my son to grow up like that... She holds his gaze with regret. Driver's about to respond when suddenly he catches a fleeting movement out of the corner of his eye. A beat -- then he suddenly lunges -- grabbing Irene and pulling her to the ground. In the same instant Tan Suit appears out of the darkness, opening fire with his automatic. Bullets spark as they hit the concrete floor and the other parked vehicles. Driver drags Irene behind a car now, covering her with his body as Tan Suit fires another burst. More sparks light up the darkness, the bullets penetrating the car with ease, narrowly missing Driver and Irene. Driver moves again, dragging the terrified Irene behind him. Tan Suit loses sight of them in the darkness, striding past rows of parked cars. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Driver turns to Irene as they take cover behind a pillar. She looks terrified -- not just of Tan Suit but of him. It's as if all her worst fears have been confirmed. Driver stares back at her, then hears Tan Suit's footsteps approaching. He holds her gaze apologetically, then gets to his feet and runs, trying to draw Tan Suit's fire. Tan Suit hears him and opens up again, more bullets lighting up the darkness. Driver keeps moving. Tan Suit strides after him, reloading, when suddenly his gun jams. Crouching behind another vehicle, Driver sees this and takes his chance, darting out after his pursuer. Tan Suit sees him coming and runs, the hunter becoming the hunted now. Still lying on the ground, Irene listens to their echoing footsteps. Driver runs after Tan Suit through the darkness, gaining all the time. Tan Suit looks desperate now, tiring. He turns to face his pursuer but Driver's on him in a flash, hurling him against a car. Tan Suit slams into the car, losing his balance. Driver grabs him, swinging him around, smashing him into another car. Irene's watching from the shadows, stunned by the violence. She picks herself up and runs towards the elevator. Driver keeps slamming Tan Suit against the car, beating the resistance out of him. As his body begins to slump, Driver grabs him by the throat and rams his head into a car window. The glass splinters with blood, the force of the blow shattering Tan Suit's skull. Driver looks around for Irene now and sees her standing in the elevator, framed against the light. She stares back at him, but makes no attempt to step out. Driver stands there, his hands covered in Tan Suit's blood. The elevator doors finally close, hiding Irene from view.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 108a EXT. LA STREET - NIGHT. 108a Shannon gets out of his car. Driver is waiting for him by his own car, silhouetted against the streetlight. Shannon stares at him a moment, then notices the blood stains on his shirt. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 108a CONTINUED: 108a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nino's guys came after me. How did they know about Irene? Shannon takes a moment to reply, looking dazed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I called Bernie...I asked if he could help. Him and Nino are like brothers. I told him you weren't interested in the money, that you only did it for the girl... (From the heart) I wanted to make sure once you returned the money that was the end of it... Driver doesn't seem to hear him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me talk to Bernie again. They probably didn't listen to him -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's too late... Shannon says nothing now, knowing he's right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're gonna come after you to find me. You have to leave... Shannon takes this in slowly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you gonna do?... Driver doesn't answer, but from his silence Shannon can guess.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How the fuck did this happen? We're supposed be in Charlotte or Daytona drinking champagne out of trophies and getting laid by pit lizards... He stares at Driver with quiet regret.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NINO'S PIZZERIA - MORNING. 110 Bernie Rose looks quietly furious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...I already gave you my advice. You should have taken your money and left this guy alone. Nino and Cook sit opposite him, both of Cook's hands broken now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not that simple, Bernie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not now that it's bounced up in your face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Paolozzi, I owe you this guy. Just give me the okay and I'll -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You like taking orders, go shut the blinds. He looks at Cook's broken hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sun's in my eyes... Nino doesn't look at Cook, a clear indication he should do as he's told. Cook stands up, humiliated, and walks over to the windows. Bernie Rose waits for Nino to explain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...The money belonged to a half assed wiseguy from Philly. I had a tip-off he was keeping a million in a pawn shop and was gonna invest it here in LA, try to run a rival operation. I wanted to teach him a lesson... The lights in the restaurant gradually fade as Cook shuts the blinds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You stole from the East Coast mob?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I stole from a jumped up punk who was gonna step on our business - (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And where did this punk find a million dollars? You ever consider he may have consulted some higher-ups? You even bother to check? -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't give a fuck who gave him their blessing. This is my city -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your city? This is a big city, pal, and last time I checked we were partners! -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are partners -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then why the fuck didn't you come to me before you set up your dummy robbery or hired this fucking amateur?!... Cook sits back down at the table, having closed the blinds. Nino looks almost embarrassed for once.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This was off to the side, Bernie. I didn't wanna involve you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, now you fucked up I am involved. Anyone finds out you stole from the family they'll kill both of us -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What family? These fucks still call me a kike to my face. I'm fifty nine years old, they pinch my cheek, treat me like a fuckin' kid. They're the reason we left New York in the first place. Decrepit old men waving us over to their dinner and domino tables to complain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those old men gave us the funds to move out here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I made them a lotta money. I made you a lotta money too... He stares at Bernie, genuinely indignant now. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I pay them half of everything I fucking earn and then they set up some fucking kid from Philadelphia just because he's a fucking wop! There's a hint of sympathy in Bernie's eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The money always flows up, Izzy. You know that. He calls Nino by his childhood name now, emphasizing the fact that they're both outsiders in this organization. For the first time Nino's tough guy act slips and he looks anxious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's why this driver has to go. Him, and maybe your friend Shannon, are the only two people who can tie me to the robbery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about this prick? He doesn't even bother to look at Cook.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Paolozzi -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up... The two friends stare at each other as if Cook didn't exist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you asking my permission?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm asking for your help. I shoulda' come to you first, Bernie. I know that. We're a team. He stares at Bernie apologetically, appealing to their friendship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll pay you back the three hundred you spent on the race car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not about the money... He stares out quietly, torn. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right... Nino nods in gratitude.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pass the salt... Cook hesitates, thinking Bernie's fucking with him for having two broken hands. He stares back dumbly and it's the final straw. Bernie suddenly grabs a stainless steel fork and rams it in his eye. As Cook screams, Bernie takes a knife and buries it in his neck. He twists the knife deeper for good measure, then with one powerful sweep of his arm clears Cook off the table. Cook's not dead yet, just writhing on the floor, choking on his own blood. Bernie Rose keeps his eyes fixed on Nino.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your turn to clean up after me...
direction.name: direction

location: TRAILER/ FILM SET/ SAN PEDRO/ LOS ANGELES
result.heading: EXT.

direction.raw_text: a EXT. TRAILER/ FILM SET/ SAN PEDRO/ LOS ANGELES - MORNING. 110a The CREW are setting up for their first shot of the day. In the background we see a DIRECTOR blocking out an action scene. Driver walks past without even a glance, heading towards the make-up trailer. He opens the door and walks in, looking around the trailer until he finds what he's looking for -- the SFX mask he saw previously on the film set.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SHANNON'S GARAGE/ SILVERLAKE BOULEVARD - MORNING. 111 Shannon limps down the steps from his office with a suitcase in his hand. He heads into the main garage then suddenly stops. Bernie Rose stands beside the stock car, waiting for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All these priceless cars, you should get better locks...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Door's always open to you... Bernie Rose heads towards him with his hands in his coat pockets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Going somewhere?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thinking about it. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm looking for your driver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You break in like this I figure it's bad news.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's bad luck. Two thousand heists in this city a year, he had to pick the wrong one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He tried to put it right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picked the wrong guy for that too. My partner's a belligerent asshole with his back against the wall... He stops, facing Shannon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right now so am I. I don't take care of this I'm in big trouble... He stares at his old friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any idea where he is?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Probably across the border by now. Mexico. Belize. That's where I'd go... Bernie Rose smiles, not believing a word.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He just walked out on you after everything you've done for him, took all the money?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's gratitude, I guess. Bernie Rose can't help grinning, fond of Shannon despite everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I ever tell you how long Izzy and I been friends? Since we were six. Only Jews in a neighborhood of wops. Long as I can remember he was getting me into trouble and I was getting him out of scrapes... He looks almost apologetic. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anyone else I'd take your side...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anyone else I'd do the same... Bernie Rose watches him with a mixture of affection and regret.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's this fucking kid to you anyway? Shannon shrugs, no idea himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I leave here without finding out where he is, there'll be others coming after me. I guarantee they'll be too stupid to figure out you won't talk and drag this out unnecessarily...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then I'm glad you got here first... Bernie Rose holds his gaze, then looks away, admiring the shiny stock car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, it's too bad, I was getting excited about our race team, having my name all over the car. I think we could have made something of this business...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nah, I'd have fucked it up too... Shannon smiles, reconciled with himself. Bernie Rose grins, and extends his hand. They shake hands firmly, like old friends, when suddenly Shannon recoils, as if he's been stung. We see now that his shirt sleeve is covered in blood, his vein cut all the way from his elbow to his wrist. He looks dazed, paralysed with shock. Bernie Rose holds a razor knife in his hand, the blade wet with Shannon's blood. He takes Shannon gently by the arm and sits him down against the boot of the stock car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You won't feel a thing. Close your eyes and you'll fall asleep... Shannon stares out numbly, the life ebbing out of him. Bernie Rose watches him quietly, wiping his bloody razor with a handkerchief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 111a INT. BERNIE ROSE'S APARTMENT - DAY. 111a Bernie Rose replaces the razor knife in a small lacquered box full of other knives. From next door he can hear his neighbors arguing again. He stands there a moment, deflated, then suddenly storms towards his front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: b EXT. CORRIDOR/ BERNIE ROSE'S NEIGHBORS' APARTMENT - DAY. 111b A loud knocking. Bernie Rose's neighbor opens his door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie Rose, next apartment over -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I know. I'm kind of busy here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I heard... There's something threatening in the old mobster's eyes now. The husband moves to close the door but Bernie jams it open with his elbow, shoves him aside, then looks over at the wife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You all right, Shonda? The woman nods without meeting his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get the hell out of my - Bernie doesn't give him time to finish, clamping a powerful hand on his throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's your fucking name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a patient man, Lenny, not much for getting in other people's way. What I figure is, we've all got our own lives, right? And the right to be left alone? (SQUEEZING HARDER) So I sit next door for almost a year now listening to what goes down in here and I keep thinking, hey, they'll work it out. You gonna work it out, Lenny? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 111b CONTINUED: 111b He jerks the husband's neck forward, making him nod.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're lucky to have her, lucky she's put up with you this long. Lucky I've put up with you. She has good reason: she loves you. I don't have any reason at all. So stop raising your voice or fucking move... He lets go of the terrified man and storms out again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DRIVER'S CAR/ RESEDA BOULEVARD - DAY. 112 Sunlight glints on the parked vehicles by the curb. Driver slows down as he approaches the sign for Shannon's Custom Kings, glancing out of the window to see if anyone's staking out the garage. Satisfied there's no-one there, he drives through.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SHANNON'S GARAGE/ RESEDA BOULEVARD - DAY. 113 Driver pulls open the garage door and sees the rows of vintage cars shimmering in the shafts of sunlight. As he heads past the vehicles he suddenly spots a figure slumped against the stock car. Shannon's eyes have been closed, his head resting gently against the trunk of the car. Driver kneels down and lifts him up in his arms, holding him for a second, then lays him down on the floor. He turns back and opens the car boot now, revealing the black gym bag full of money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SHANNON'S GARAGE/ RESEDA BOULEVARD - DAY. 114 Driver's car roars out of the garage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NINO'S PIZZERIA - SUNSET. 115 Nino stands in the kitchen, wearing a beautiful suit but no shoes or socks, listening on his cell phone. We hold on the curious image for a moment, then reveal a beautifully dressed
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: polishing his shoes. And now we see more of Nino's MEN, also smartly dressed and accompanied by GORGEOUS WOMEN, getting ready for an event. Nino's talking to his wife on the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright honey, I'll pick you up in an hour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NINO'S PIZZERIA - SUNSET. 116 Two big Lincoln Towncars are parked outside. Across the road we recognize Driver's car. He opens the trunk. When he closes it again we see that he's wearing the eerily convincing SFX mask. He crosses the road, entering the pizzeria.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NINO'S PIZZERIA - SUNSET. 117 Several of Nino's men look up as Driver enters but none of them recognize him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're closed... Driver stares past them at Nino in the kitchen, surrounded by more of his men. We feel his mind calculating then he walks out again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NINO'S PIZZERIA - NIGHT. 118 Nino emerges with his bodyguards now, heading towards one of the white Lincolns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (To one of his men) I'm going to pick up my wife. I'll meet you there... Across the road Driver climbs into his car, still wearing the mask. He starts his car, setting off after Nino's Lincoln.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DRIVER'S CAR/ NINO'S PIZZERIA/ WESTWOOD - NIGHT. 119 Driver drifts in behind a couple of other cars, keeping them between himself and the Lincoln.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . STREETS - NIGHT. 120 The sunlight is fading fast. The neon cityscape has come to life and the streets are a sea of glittering lights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NINO'S CAR/ STREETS - NIGHT. 121 The CHAUFFEUR checks his mirror as he turns into another street, seeing only the anonymous glare of headlights behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DRIVER'S CAR/ STREETS - NIGHT. 122 Driver slows down and lets another car turn in front of him, keeping it between himself and Nino's car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . STREETS - NIGHT. 123 The streets are less crowded in this residential area. As the car in front of Driver pulls into its front drive, Driver takes the next turning, making sure the Lincoln doesn't spot him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DRIVER'S CAR/ PARALLEL STREET - NIGHT. 124 Driver cruises along another residential street. At every intersection we glimpse the Lincoln heading in the same direction down a parallel street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SAN VINCENTE BOULEVARD/ BRENTWOOD - NIGHT. 125 The Lincoln turns back into traffic on San Vincente.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NINO'S CAR/ SAN VINCENTE BOULEVARD - NIGHT. 126 Nino's talking on a cell phone in the back seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Sure, Carlo, I'll send him your regards...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DRIVER'S CAR/ SAN VINCENTE BOULEVARD - NIGHT. 127 Driver merges in with the traffic, weaving between the cars in front of him until he has Nino's Lincoln back in his sights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AERIAL VIEW/ SAN VINCENTE BOULEVARD - NIGHT. 128 The sun has almost set, the red backlights of the cars blinking in the fading light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NINO'S CAR/ SAN VINCENTE/ 7TH STREET - NIGHT. 129 Nino's car turns into 7th Street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DRIVER'S CAR/ SAN VINCENTE/ 7TH STREET - NIGHT. 130 This time there are no other vehicles turning into the same street. Driver has no choice, settling in behind the Lincoln.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NINO'S CAR/ 7TH STREET/ PACIFIC PALISADES - NIGHT. 131 The chauffeur glances in his rear-view mirror and spots Driver's car for the first time. For now he doesn't give it much thought. In the back seat Nino finally says goodbye on the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Nice talking to you too... (As he hangs up) Asshole...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ENTRADA DRIVE/ PACIFIC PALISADES - NIGHT. 132 Both cars head into Entrada Drive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NINO'S CAR/ ENTRADA DRIVE/ PACIFIC PALISADES - NIGHT. 133 The chauffeur checks his mirror again and notices Driver's car still on his tail. Just as a precaution he slows down, seeing if the pursuing car will overtake.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: NINO'S CAR/ ENTRADA DRIVE/ PACIFIC PALISADES

direction.raw_text: . DRIVER'S CAR/ ENTRADA DRIVE - NIGHT. 134 Driver has to decide in an instant whether to take up the invitation. He overtakes the Lincoln, speeding ahead.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: NINO'S CAR/ ENTRADA DRIVE/ PACIFIC PALISADES

direction.raw_text: . NINO'S CAR/ ENTRADA DRIVE/ PACIFIC PALISADES - NIGHT. 135 Nino's chauffeur sees Driver's car disappear up ahead, relaxing now.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: DRIVER'S CAR/ WEST CHANNEL ROAD/ PCH

direction.raw_text: . DRIVER'S CAR/ WEST CHANNEL ROAD/ PCH - NIGHT. 136 Driver puts his foot on the gas, taking sharp turns on small side streets, driving fast around the block until he's back on the Lincoln's tail, keeping a safe distance now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NINO'S CAR/ W.CHANNEL RD./ PCH - NIGHT. 137 Nino's chauffeur turns right into the Pacific Coast Highway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DRIVER'S CAR/ PACIFIC COAST HIGHWAY - NIGHT. 138 Driver follows the Lincoln at a distance, keeping the winding corners of the PCH between himself and his prey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AERIAL VIEW/ PACIFIC COAST HIGHWAY - NIGHT. 139 From above we see Driver's car gliding along the open highway, the rising hills on one side, the churning ocean on the other, no vehicles in sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NINO'S CAR/ PACIFIC COAST HIGHWAY - NIGHT. 140 In the back seat Nino dials another number on his cell-phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Bernie, it's me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AERIAL VIEW/ PACIFIC COAST HIGHWAY - NIGHT. 141 The headlights of Driver's car sweep ahead of it on the open road. From above it looks like a shark closing in on its prey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BERNIE ROSE'S APARTMENT/ LA - NIGHT. 142 Bernie Rose stands by the window, listening to the phone in silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NINO'S CAR/ PACIFIC COAST HIGHWAY - NIGHT. 143 Nino sounds apologetic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Look, about that thing today...I'm sorry. I know how much you liked the guy... In his rear view mirror the chauffeur sees the headlights of the car behind getting closer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DRIVER'S CAR/ PACIFIC COAST HIGHWAY - NIGHT. 144 Driver stares ahead, his eyes fixed on the Lincoln's backlights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BERNIE ROSE'S APARTMENT - NIGHT. 145 Bernie Rose doesn't speak, looking weary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie?...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah?...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're the only fucking person in the world I trust. I love you, man... Bernie shakes his head, the same old apologies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NINO'S CAR/ PACIFIC COAST HIGHWAY - NIGHT. 146 In the front seat Nino's chauffeur checks his mirror curiously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When this is over I'll make it up to you, I swear... The lights of the car behind have vanished.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AERIAL VIEW/ PACIFIC COAST HIGHWAY - NIGHT. 147 Even from above we can't see Driver's car with its lights off - no idea how close it is to Nino's car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BERNIE ROSE'S APARTMENT - NIGHT. 148 Even though he's still angry, Bernie can't help forgiving his childhood friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How many times I heard that before...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NINO'S CAR/ PACIFIC COAST HIGHWAY - NIGHT. 149 Nino grins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I lost count - Suddenly blazing headlights explode to life behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DRIVER'S CAR/ PACIFIC COAST HIGHWAY - NIGHT. 150 Driver rams the Lincoln at over a hundred miles an hour, hitting it just above the left rear wheel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PACIFIC COAST HIGHWAY - NIGHT. 151 The impact is momentous. The huge Continental is lifted up in the air and spun round at the same time. It slams back into the tarmac then flips end over end for a hundred yards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BERNIE ROSE'S APARTMENT - NIGHT. 152 Bernie Rose is left holding the phone as the line goes dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DRIVER'S CAR/ PACIFIC COAST HIGHWAY - NIGHT. 153 The collision has barely knocked Driver off course. His car skids to a stop near the overturned wreck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NINO'S CAR/ PACIFIC COAST HIGHWAY - NIGHT. 154 Among the carnage, we see Nino, bloodied but still alive. He unbuckles his seat belt and crawls out of the twisted wreck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PACIFIC COAST HIGHWAY - NIGHT. 155 Driver gets out of his car, calmly walking over to the pulverized Lincoln. He sees Nino stumbling off towards the beach but doesn't hurry after him yet. He checks to make sure the other passengers are dead, then heads on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BEACH/ OCEAN/ PACIFIC COAST HIGHWAY - NIGHT. 156 Nino stumbles through the sand, running for his life now. He looks behind him and sees Driver calmly pursuing him. He keeps running, but he's badly injured, slowing all the time. Fear clouds reason and he staggers towards the crashing waves. Driver slows down as he watches the gangster wade into the ocean, a pathetic last attempt to evade him. The crashing waves and the undertow are an impenetrable wall. Every time Nino tries to wade out further, the ocean drags him back. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Driver stares at his trapped prey. Nino's attempts become more and more feeble as the ocean exhausts him and snuffs out any hope of escape. Finally he retreats back into the shallow water, barely able to keep his footing. He turns around and faces Driver, the crashing waves still smashing into his back. They stay like that for a moment. Gazing at each other. Driver silhouetted against the white sand. Nino trapped in the ocean. Then Driver wades out into the water. Nino has no fight left in him, staring at the masked man. Driver stares back at him then grabs him by the throat, forcing his head under the water. Nino splutters as Driver lets him up again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was Bernie...Bernie Rose killed your friend not me... Driver shoves his face back under the water, keeping it there until Nino's body finally stops thrashing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BERNIE ROSE'S APARTMENT/ BEL AIR - NIGHT. 157 A phone shrills. Bernie Rose answers it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nino?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's dead. Bernie Rose stares out in silence. Whatever he thinks of Nino, a part of him has died. We feel the regret in his eyes but there's no trace of emotion in his voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks like me, you and your girlfriend are the only pieces left on the board...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BEACH/ OCEAN - NIGHT. 158 Driver is no longer wearing a mask, framed against the ocean. He catches the veiled threat in Bernie's words but doesn't respond.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd say this has gone far enough. See any reason why it should go on?...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doesn't have to... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then we should talk. You know a place called the Great Wall -- out on Sherman Way?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can find it. Bernie pauses, staring out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll see you there at one. A charged silence, then the line goes dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GREAT WALL RESTAURANT/ LINCOLN BOULEVARD - DAY. 160 A large Chinese restaurant. We follow Driver through the crowd. He sees Bernie Rose sitting at a table on his own, pouring himself a glass of wine. The mobster's dressed for the occasion, wearing a jacket and tie. He smiles at Driver as he sits down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Care for a glass?... Driver doesn't smile, gazing back at him across the table. Bernie Rose doesn't seem to care.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can recommend the duck. Hell, I can recommend everything -- Walnut prawns, shredded beef, Velvet chicken -- but the duck's to die for... He delivers the last line with a pointed smile, then turns away, calling over a WAITRESS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The duck, please. For two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anything else?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, thanks... He waits for the waitress to leave, then turns back to Driver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've been on a roll. Cut yourself quite a swath out there. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never asked for any of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We usually don't. But it comes down on our heads regardless. Look at Shannon... Driver holds his gaze, the tension palpable, laughter and conversation drifting over from the other tables.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anyway it's water under the bridge now. Question is where does that leave us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's up to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You bring the cash? Driver nods. Bernie Rose studies him quietly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me something, how does someone with no interest in money get mixed up in a heist? (Off his silence) Shannon told me it was because of the girl? Driver hesitates, betraying a hint of concern. Bernie sees it and smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry. Nobody else knows about her. Just me... (A BEAT) You still see her?...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's not interested.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's got her head screwed on right. I got two ex-wives, three kids, four grandchildren. Not one of them speaks to me now... He smiles again, looking into Driver's eyes with just a hint of sympathy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is what I'll do for you. You give me the money, nobody knows she exists. But it's a different matter with you. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: BERNIE ROSE (cont'd) These people I have the misfortune to be involved with, they don't mind Nino being gone, but they'll wanna know what happened to him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sounds like we have a problem...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And just when we were getting to know each other... Their eyes are fixed on each other, deadly enemies but kindred spirits of a kind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...We shake hands, say goodbye, it's the start of your new life. Sooner or later they'll come after you. No end to it. Someone gets tired, somebody else takes their place. It goes on and on. Whatever dreams you have, whatever plans, you might as well forget `em, because this is what it's gonna be like till the day you die... (A BEAT) I just thought you should know... Driver stares back at him quietly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you suggest I do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First time I heard about you, Shannon told me you drove. Fast. That's a start... He keeps staring at Driver, then smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Either that or you choke on the duck...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARKING LOT/ LINCOLN BOULEVARD - DAY. 161 Driver's car is parked at the back of the parking lot, half hidden by a fenced area for garbage. Driver pops the trunk, taking out the black gym bag with the cash. Bernie Rose doesn't even look at it, still admiring the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much does something like this cost?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nine, ten thousand. If you can find one that still runs. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe I'll take yours. Part of our deal. He grins, then holds out his hand for the gym bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guess we won't be seeing each other again.. Driver reaches out to give him the bag, when suddenly Bernie's hand snakes out of his pocket, twisting a switch-blade into Driver's gut. He pulls it out, ready to stab again, but this time Driver catches his wrist, slowly forcing the knife up to his throat. Their eyes are fixed on each other for a moment, with something like regret, then the blade pierces Bernie Rose's neck, sinking deeper and deeper. Driver holds the old man in his arms as he dies. They stay like that, locked in a fatal embrace, then Driver lowers Bernie Rose gently to the ground, out of sight. Blood seeping through his shirt, Driver picks up the gym bag and puts it back in the trunk, slamming the door shut.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: OF A MUCH LARGER PARKING LOT/ LA

direction.raw_text: . AERIAL VIEW OF A MUCH LARGER PARKING LOT/ LA - DAY. 162 We're looking down on an enormous parking lot, hundreds of different colored vehicles gleaming down below. Driver pulls into the lot, searching for a place to park.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LARGE PARKING LOT/ LA - DAY. 163 Driver climbs out of his car, wearing a jacket over his blood- soaked shirt. He walks to the back of the car, kneels down, and hides the keys behind the left rear wheel, drops of blood dripping on the tarmac beneath him. He gets up again, then sets off through the maze of parked vehicles, dialling a number on his cell-phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ECHO PARK - DAY. 164 Irene and Benicio sit in the park.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Picking up her phone) Hello?... (INTERCUT) The blazing sun beats down. Driver walks through a long corridor of glinting cars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's me... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Irene stares in surprise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't hang up... She says nothing but stays on the line. Driver continues painfully through the maze of cars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got a pen? I need you to write something down... Irene looks confused as she hears the quiet urgency in his voice, then reaches inside her handbag. Sunlight glitters on the roofs of the parked cars, dazzling Driver's eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the license number for my car. I've left it in a parking lot on the corner of Culver and Lincoln. Section M 10... Irene writes down the details, looking even more confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a bag in the trunk with some money. Keys are under the left rear wheel...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want me to do with it?... Driver walks with difficulty, finding it hard to breathe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's yours. It's safe to keep it... All around him the Chevys, Dodges, and Fords glitter in the sunlight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you, I don't need your money... Blood seeps through Driver's shirt, dripping on the tarmac. Irene hears his labored breathing now, looking concerned. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you okay?... Driver's skin looks deathly pale, his eyes a haunting shade of blue. He keeps walking through the maze of cars, casting his eyes from one vehicle to the next, looking for the perfect ride.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just out of breath... Finally he spots a beautiful white Camaro up ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How're you doing?... For the first time we see the Echo Park fountain sparkling in the background.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine. I'm in the park with Benicio... Irene can no longer hold back her tears, heartbroken. Driver stops in front of the white Camaro, unsteady on his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gotta go Irene... He pauses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meeting you was the best thing that ever happened to me... Irene smiles sadly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was nice to meet you too...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LARGE PARKING LOT/ LA - DAY. 165 From above we see the maze of vehicles stretching out forever -- Chevys, Chryslers, Fords -- the history of America on wheels. Driver switches off his cell-phone reluctantly then heads towards the Camaro.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WHITE CAMARO/ LARGE PARKING LOT - DAY. 166 Driver climbs into the front seat of the Camaro, catching his breath. He sits there a moment, sheltering from the world outside, then pulls out a pocket knife, opening the blades until he finds the screwdriver. He starts with the left side of the steering column, then gets to work on the section below the turn signal. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His face shows the strain, but his fingers are as steady as ever. A master at work. Finally he breaks into the ignition device, leaning back in the seat to take a rest.
direction.name: direction
